intro: Impatiens sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and a trailing growth habit, making it suitable for hanging baskets or as a ground cover. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique beauty and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
